name: Scapular Wall Slides
setup: Stand with back against wall, feet 6-12 inches away
Flatten lower back against wall (posterior pelvic tilt)
Arms at sides, elbows bent 90°, palms forward
Back of hands, elbows, and shoulders touching wall
steps: Slide arms up the wall, maintaining contact with hands and elbows
Raise arms overhead as high as possible without losing wall contact
Pause at top, then slide back down to start
Keep shoulder blades down and back throughout
cues: Don't arch lower back off wall
mistakes: Arching lower back off wall to gain range
Losing elbow or hand contact with wall
safety: If shoulders feel pinched or painful, reduce range or widen elbow angle. Great for shoulder health and scapular control.

regressions: Partial range wall slides (hands to shoulder height only)

prescriptionHints.notes: Excellent warm-up for overhead pressing or pulling. Focus on quality over quantity.

joints.notes: Keep shoulder blades depressed and retracted. Avoid compensating with lower back arch.
